comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Carl Curman took an interesting group photograph at "Skraenten" during this 1888 visit. The young people have been interrupted in a game of billiards, and a group was arranged in front of “Skrænten”. This photograph is from the Hirschsprung Silver Wedding Album, and in the collection of the Hirschsprung Museum. (Perhaps The Swedish National Heritage Board also has it in their collection!) "Party at "Skrænten" 1888" by Carl Curman "From the left we see Calla Curman and Heinrich and Pauline Hirschsprung. Behind them their daughter Ellen, Emilie Bache (daughter of the painter Otto Bache), [lawyer] A.P. Weis, [violinist] Anton Svendsen, [painter] P.S. Krøyer, behind him Ivar Hirschsprung and the lady's companion Miss Louise Michaëlis. In front of her, Oscar can be seen in military uniform, and sitting on the steps the two brothers Aage (left) and Robert Hirschsprung." (View larger.)

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Pixel Wrangler: We don't have the photo in our collection, and this was indeed an interesting information you gave us! It's always useful to know in which other institutions the photographers of our collections are represented. 
We have original print copies of many of Carl Curman's photos - hence the glass plate negatives of these photos could be stored in other archives.
/Anna B
